intro: Stenandriopsis leptostachys var. leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stalked stenandriopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in racemes. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
